name: market for sunflower silage | sunflower silage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4331/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'sunflower silage', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;The product 'sunflower silage' represents preserved pasture used for animal feed. Sunflower is an annual crop. The sunflowers are cut, collected and then fermented.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'sunflower silage',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  sunflower silage', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production
